page.title: 06Wingate Grange Farm
page.content: Wingate Grange Farm covers a total area of{700 acres}made up from a number of smaller areas{around Wingate {and}the nearby village of{Blackhall. The present owner has farmed there for fifteen years but could not supply details of its history. The farm concentrates{mainly}in the areas of{arable farming and beef production. To compensate for the poor summer weather the farmer has invested in a{large drying shed}to reduce the moisture content of the grain. Two types of{cattle}are kept, {charolais}and{fresian,}the former for beef and the latter for milk as a supplementary product. {Fir trees}are grown as a{cash crop in the form of{Christmas Tree {Equipment}includes a selection of {tractors,}a{combined harvester}and a {small aircraft}for crop spraying.
